page.title: 08Transport
page.content: The D-Block is well served by major roads. These include the A540, from Chester to Hoylake; the A548 to Queensferry and the B519 to Hawarden Airport.There are also many minor roads serving the Blacon housing estate and various farms. The area is well served by both private and public transport. There are 3 taxi operators, 3 car-hire firms; private cars are used by a large proportion of the residents. Motor bikes are very popular among the younger generation and most school children have bicycles. Chester Corporation provide the local bus services, longer distance travel is provided by Crosville. The Shropshire Union Canal passes through the area, it is used for pleasure trips and freight. The railway was closed in 1982.
